items.text: A Psalm or Song for the sabbath day.
items.plainText: A Psalm or Song for the sabbath day.

items.text: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD, and to sing praises unto thy name, O most High:
items.plainText: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD, and to sing praises unto thy name, O most High:

items.text: To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night,
items.plainText: To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night,

items.text: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon the harp with a solemn sound.
items.plainText: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon the harp with a solemn sound.

items.text: For thou, LORD, hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.
items.plainText: For thou, LORD, hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.

items.text: O LORD, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.
items.plainText: O LORD, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.

items.text: A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.
items.plainText: A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.

items.text: When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; it is that they shall be destroyed for ever:
items.plainText: When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; it is that they shall be destroyed for ever:

items.text: But thou, LORD, art most high for evermore.
items.plainText: But thou, LORD, art most high for evermore.

items.text: For, lo, thine enemies, O LORD, for, lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
items.plainText: For, lo, thine enemies, O LORD, for, lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

items.text: But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.
items.plainText: But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.

items.text: Mine eye also shall see my desire on mine enemies, and mine ears shall hear my desire of the wicked that rise up against me.
items.plainText: Mine eye also shall see my desire on mine enemies, and mine ears shall hear my desire of the wicked that rise up against me.

items.text: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
items.plainText: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

items.text: Those that be planted in the house of the LORD shall flourish in the courts of our God.
items.plainText: Those that be planted in the house of the LORD shall flourish in the courts of our God.

items.text: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing;
items.plainText: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing;

items.text: To shew that the LORD is upright: he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
items.plainText: To shew that the LORD is upright: he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
